message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. HBsAb is the serologic marker for immunity to hepatitis B virus, while the other options are markers for presence of the virus or previous infection.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. HBsAb indicates immunity to hepatitis B virus. HBsAg and HBeAg are antigens that indicate current infection, while HBcAb indicates a past infection.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. HBsAb is the surface antibody to the hepatitis B virus, which indicates immunity to the virus either from vaccination or past infection. HBsAgrn is the surface antigen, HBcAbrn is the core antibody, and HBeAg is the antigen that indicates active viral replication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only HBsAb (hepatitis B surface antibody) indicates immunity to the hepatitis B virus. HBsAg (hepatitis B surface antigen) indicates current infection or carrier status, HBcAb (hepatitis B core antibody) indicates past infection, and HBeAg (hepatitis B e antigen) indicates active viral replication and increased infectivity.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. HBsAb (hepatitis B surface antibody) is the serologic marker that indicates immunity to hepatitis B virus. HBsAg (hepatitis B surface antigen) indicates an acute or chronic infection, while HBcAb (hepatitis B core antibody) can indicate past infection or ongoing viral replication. HBeAg indicates active viral replication and increased infectivity.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. HBsAb (hepatitis B surface antibody) is indicative of immunity to the hepatitis B virus, as it is produced in response to either past infection or vaccination. The other options are serologic markers for either active or past infection of the hepatitis B virus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. HBsAb (hepatitis B surface antibody) is produced in response to hepatitis B vaccination or after recovering from a hepatitis B infection, and indicates immunity to the virus. HBsAgrn (hepatitis B surface antigen), HBcAbrn (hepatitis B core antibody), and HBeAg (hepatitis B e antigen) are all indicative of active or recent infection, not immunity.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. HBsAb, or anti-HBs, is a marker for immunity to the hepatitis B virus. HBsAg is a marker for active infection, HBcAb is a marker for past infection or vaccination, and HBeAg is a marker for active replication of the virus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only HBsAb (hepatitis B surface antibody) indicates immunity to the hepatitis B virus. HBsAgrn and HBeAg indicate active infection, while HBcAbrn indicates past or current infection but does not provide immunity.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only HBsAb (hepatitis B surface antibody) indicates immunity to hepatitis B virus. HBsAgrn (hepatitis B surface antigen), HBcAbrn (hepatitis B core antibody), and HBeAg are markers for active infection or possible previous exposure.
